meanings.definition: An insect of the order Hemiptera, characterized by sucking mouthparts and forewings that are thickened at the base.
meanings.sent1: The hemipter crawled slowly on the leaf, using its sucking mouthparts to feed.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a hemipter on the plant, its forewings thickened at the base.
meanings.sent3: The hemipter tried to play hide-and-seek with the other insects, but its thickened forewings gave it away.
meanings.sent4: The hemipter, with its unique mouthparts and thickened forewings, was like a tiny alien exploring the garden.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the hemipter's silhouette with its distinct features stood out against the leaf.

meanings.definition: To hemipter is to belong to the order Hemiptera.
meanings.sent1: Many insects hemipter in the wild, adapting to their surroundings.
meanings.sent2: I learned that the small bug in the garden will hemipter as it matures.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar decided to hemipter and join the Hemiptera club.
meanings.sent4: As the seasons change, the butterflies will hemipter and transform into beautiful creatures.
meanings.sent5: The insect world is vast, with each species hemiptering in its unique way.
